thread.title: Arsenal news: Gunners scouts refused entry to watch Lincoln at North Ferriby | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Gunners scouts refused entry to watch Lincoln at North Ferriby | Metro News

author: Chris Davie For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Gunners scouts refused entry to watch Lincoln at North Ferriby | Metro News
text:
Chris Davie for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 10:50 am Arsenal’s scouts were unable to watch Lincoln in action. (AMA/Getty Images) 
Arsenal’s scouts were refused entry to watch Lincoln City because there was no room at the stadium they were playing in. 
Lincoln are the only non-league side who remain in the FA Cup and could reach Wembley if they pull off a huge upset against Gunners in the quarter-final next month. 
Lincoln, who knocked Burnley out of the FA Cup at the weekend, were in action against North Ferriby United on Tuesday evening and managed to secure a 1-0 victory. 
But Arsenal’s scouts were unable to run the rule over their future opponents due to United’s Grange Lane stadium only having a 2,700 capacity. Lincoln knocked Burnley out of the FA Cup on Saturday. (Getty Images) Burnely now travel to Arsenal in the FA Cup quarter-final. (Getty Images)
